title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhuang C (2025). homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Methods. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://carolinezhuang23.github.io/homework6.
code: @Manual{,   title = {homework6: Sparse Numeric Vector Methods},   author = {Caroline Zhuang},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://carolinezhuang23.github.io/homework6}, }

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Methods
text: homework6 package implements S4 class sparse_numeric sparse numeric vectors, elements zero. non-zero values positions stored. package provides: Coercion base numeric sparse_numeric sparse_add(), sparse_sub(), sparse_mult(), sparse_div(), sparse_crossprod() Operator overloads: +, -, *, / sparse_numeric plot() method visualize overlapping non-zero entries mean() (including zeros) norm() (Euclidean norm) standardize() (center scale)

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Methods
text: can install development version homework6 like :
code: # from the package root directory devtools::install()

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Methods
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(homework6) #>  #> Attaching package: 'homework6' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm ## basic example code x <- as(c(0, 1, 0, 3), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(2, 0, 4, -1), "sparse_numeric")  x + y            # sparse addition #> Vector has value 2 at position 1 #> Vector has value 1 at position 2 #> Vector has value 4 at position 3 #> Vector has value 2 at position 4 mean(x)          # mean including zeros #> [1] 1 norm(x)          # Euclidean norm #> [1] 3.162278 z <- standardize(x) plot(x, y)

text: Displays content sparse_numeric vector, printing non-zero zero elements well position.

Show a sparse_numeric object — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: object sparse_numeric vector

title: Show a sparse_numeric object — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: Invisibly returns sparse_numeric vector

what: Add two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_add
title: Add two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_add
text: Adds two sparse_numeric vectors length element-wise, returning new sparse_numeric object containing non-zero elements sum

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_add
code: sparse_add(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_add(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 + e2

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_add
text: x sparse_numeric vector y sparse_numeric vector ... ignored. e1 sparse_numeric object (left-hand operand +). e2 sparse_numeric object (right-hand operand +).

title: Add two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_add
text: sparse_numeric vector representing x + y

what: Cross multiplies two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_crossprod
title: Cross multiplies two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_crossprod
text: Computes sum pairwise products non-zero entries two sparse_numeric vectors (simple cross-product).

title: Cross multiplies two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_crossprod
code: sparse_crossprod(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_crossprod(x, y)

title: Cross multiplies two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_crossprod
text: x sparse_numeric vector y sparse_numeric vector ... ignored.

title: Cross multiplies two sparse numeric vectors together — sparse_crossprod
text: numeric scalar representing cross product x y

title: Divide two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_div
text: Computes element-wise integer division two sparse_numeric vectors length, storing non-zero results.

title: Divide two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_div
code: sparse_div(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_div(x, y)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1/e2

title: Divide two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_div
text: x sparse_numeric object (numerator). y sparse_numeric object (denominator). ... Ignored. e1 sparse_numeric object (left-hand operand \). e2 sparse_numeric object (right-hand operand \)

title: Divide two sparse_numeric vectors — sparse_div
text: sparse_numeric object representing floor(x / y) positions vectors non-zero.

text: S4 class represents sparse numeric vector. sparse numeric vector vector majority elements zero.
